macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Closes Mostly Flat as Inflation Data Eases Concerns
items.summary: The S&P 500 and Dow finished little changed on Friday, February 13, while the Nasdaq Composite gained 0.2%. A softer-than-expected January inflation report (2.4% year-over-year headline, 2.5% core) provided support, though major averages remain about 1.5% lower for the week.

items.title: US500 Index Rises to 6,836 Points Amid Sector Rotation
items.summary: The US500 gained 0.05% to 6,836 points on February 13, 2026. Over the past month the index has declined 1.31%, though it remains 11.80% higher than a year ago. The market has experienced a vicious rotation from growth to value stocks, with technology and software selling off.

items.title: Technical Breakdown Signals Potential Market Weakness Ahead
items.summary: The S&P 500 broke support at both the 20- and 50-day moving averages on Thursday, with money flows turning negative. Current support sits at 6,790 to 6,825, with a break below potentially leading to moves toward 6,780 and 6,720.

items.title: AST SpaceMobile Stock Plunges 18.9% on Dilution Concerns
items.summary: AST SpaceMobile shares fell 18.9% for the week following the company's announcement of additional capital raising. The stock is already down approximately 32.5% from 2026 highs, with the company warning of potential substantial volume impacts from note holder transactions.

items.title: Presidents' Day Market Closure to Reduce Liquidity Next Week
items.summary: US stock and bond markets will be closed on Monday, February 16, 2026 for Presidents' Day. This shortened trading week is expected to reduce liquidity and amplify moves around well-defined technical levels, with key economic data releases scheduled for Tuesday.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Holds Steady at $68,800 Amid Market Stabilization
items.summary: Bitcoin futures are hovering near $68,800, stabilizing after a retracement from last year's highs above $110,000, while Ethereum trades around $2,050, down nearly 50% from prior peaks. This occurs against a cooling Nasdaq backdrop, indicating a transitional phase rather than expansion.[1]

items.title: Trump Media Files for Bitcoin, Ethereum, and CRO ETFs
items.summary: Trump Media and Technology Group, majority-owned by President Trump, filed for two new crypto ETFs: one tracking Bitcoin and Ethereum, and another providing exposure to CRO via the 'Truth Social Cronos Yield Maximizer ETF' in partnership with Crypto.com.[2]

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Headwinds as Inflation Cools but Demand Hesitates
items.summary: Despite softer CPI data at 2.4% headline and 2.5% core, Bitcoin spot demand remains weak with ETF net outflows reaching $686 million over two days and aggressive sell-side pressure capping upside near $68,900.[3]

items.title: Bitcoin Down 35% from October Peak, Meme Coins Plunge 95%
items.summary: Bitcoin has declined 35% from its October high, trading below election levels, while $TRUMP and $MELANIA meme coins have dropped 95% amid broader market storm.[4]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Moonshot AI Releases Kimi K2.5 Open Weights Model and Kimi Code
items.summary: Moonshot AI launched the open-source Kimi K2.5, a native multimodal model trained on 15 trillion tokens excelling in coding and video benchmarks. They also released Kimi Code, a coding agent supporting images and videos as input in terminals or IDEs.

items.title: DeepSeek Launches V3.2 Flagship Model and Reasoning Variant
items.summary: DeepSeek released its 685-billion-parameter V3.2 model and experimental reasoning-enhanced V3.2-Speciale, openly available under MIT license with gold-medal IMO math performance.

items.title: Prime Intellect Unveils INTELLECT-3 106B MoE Model
items.summary: Prime Intellect open-sourced INTELLECT-3, a 106 billion parameter Mixture-of-Experts model strong in math, code, and reasoning via reinforcement learning, including the full training stack.

items.title: Moonshot AI Introduces Kimi K2 Thinking Model
items.summary: Moonshot AI launched Kimi K2 Thinking, an open-source reasoning agent for step-by-step problem-solving and chaining hundreds of tool calls, outperforming rivals on benchmarks with strong long-context retention.

items.title: Brain-Inspired Machines Excel at Math Beyond Expectations
items.summary: Neuromorphic computers modeled after the human brain solve complex physics equations efficiently, potentially enabling low-energy supercomputers and revealing brain processing insights.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: GTA 6 Trailer Surpasses 475 Million Views Ahead of November 2026 Launch
items.summary: Grand Theft Auto 6's official trailer has crossed 475 million views, signaling record-breaking anticipation for the game's November 19, 2026 release. Rockstar Games and platform holders Sony and Microsoft are preparing infrastructure to handle unprecedented server loads and concurrent player demand on launch day.

items.title: Mattel Acquires Full Ownership of Mattel163 Mobile Games Studio from NetEase
items.summary: Mattel announced an agreement to acquire full ownership of its Mattel163 mobile games studio joint venture with NetEase, strengthening its digital games business. The transaction is expected to complete by the end of Q1 2026.

items.title: ProbablyMonsters Announces Crimson Moon, Gothic High Renaissance Action-RPG
items.summary: Independent developer ProbablyMonsters unveiled Crimson Moon, a Gothic High Renaissance action-adventure RPG featuring intense combat and character progression. Players take on the role of a Nephilim knight fighting to reclaim the fallen city of Gildenarch.

items.title: Unity Reports Strong Q4 2025 Financial Results with Vector Platform Growth
items.summary: Unity announced fourth quarter and fiscal year 2025 financial results, with exceptional performance from its Vector platform experiencing mid-teen sequential revenue growth and Create division showing its best growth in over two years.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Four New Astronauts Arrive at ISS to Replace Evacuated Crew
items.summary: SpaceX delivered NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, France's Sophie Adenot, and Russia's Andrei Fedyaev to the International Space Station on February 14, 2026, restoring full crew strength after a medical evacuation last month.

items.title: Joanna Stern Departs Wall Street Journal After 12 Years in Tech Journalism
items.summary: Veteran tech journalist Joanna Stern announced her departure from The Wall Street Journal on February 14, 2026, reflecting on how technology has transformed various aspects of life during her tenure.

items.title: New Drone Technology Highlighted in Agriculture Sector Update
items.summary: RealAg reported on advancements in drone technology alongside research adoption focus by RDAR and rising beef prices in its weekend update covering February 14-15, 2026.
